intro: Acinodendron humile, commonly known as the small acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Acinodendron humile is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forests or along riverbanks.
